subject: Testing Accessor Methods
msgSnippet: I m a consulting architect at a fortune ten company - our Java community numbers ~600.  One of the challenges we face is the conversation around unit testing
messageBody:
I'm a consulting architect at a fortune ten company - our Java
community numbers ~600. One of the challenges we face is the
conversation around unit testing and code coverage - "what to do
with accessor methods".

Accordingly, adjunct to the Extreme Non-programming (XN) non-
movement - an open source project (TestUtil) has been launched as
follows:

"TestUtil" is a Java open source "Accessor Verification Facilitator"
(AVF) providing a low-effort strategy for unit testing matching
accessor methods on a mutable object with a single line of test code.

Any feedback on this topic, the approach, or the tool is welcomed!

(And if you're interested in being a TestUtil developer ... :-)

_Marvin
